translated: Connected Discourses With Sāriputta 25.1🔽1. The Eye
Linked Discourses The Six Sense Fields The Six Sense Fields

analyzed: sāvatthi nidāna  cakkhu bhikkhave aniccam vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi
translated: At Sāvatthī. 🔽“Monks, the eye is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise. 🔽The ear is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.

original: sotaṁ aniccaṁ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi;🔽ghānaṁ aniccaṁ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi;
analyzed: aniccam vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi  ghānam aniccam vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi
translated: The nose is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
The tongue is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
The body is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
The mind is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ saddahati adhimuccati—ayaṁ vuccati saddhānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṁ, sappurisabhūmiṁ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṁ;🔽abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam saddahati adhimuccati ayam vuccati saddhā anusārī okkantaḥ sammatta niyāma sappurisa bhūmim okkantaḥ vītivattaḥ puthujjana bhūmi  abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: “One who has confidence & trust in these teachings—‘They are beneficial,’ ‘They are wholesome,’ ‘They are skillful,’ ‘They are a holy one’s way’—is called a follower by confidence. He has come to the fold by confidence, come to the fold by the true Teaching. He has transcended doubt, gotten past uncertainty, and become independent of others regarding the Teacher’s True Teaching.

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: He is incapable of doing any deed by which he might be reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the sphere of afflicted spirits. He is incapable of passing away until he has realized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṁ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṁ khamanti, ayaṁ vuccati: ‘dhammānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṁ, sappurisabhūmiṁ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṁ;
analyzed: yassa kho bhikkhave ime dhammā evam paññāya mattasaḥ nijjhānam khamanti ayam vuccati dhamma anusārī okkantaḥ sammatta niyāma sappurisa bhūmim okkantaḥ vītivatto puthujjana bhūmi
translated: “Bhikkhus, those in whom these ideas are thus fully comprehended by direct knowledge, are called ‘Dhamma-followers,’ ‘entered the stream,’ ‘attained to the fixed course,’ ‘gone to a safe place,’ ‘cut the bondage,’ ‘become free from the abyss,’ ‘become fearless,’ ‘become unagitated,’ ‘become unshaken,’ ‘become cool,’ ‘become extinguished.’

original: abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: They cannot do anything that should lead to rebirth in hell, in the animal realm, or in the sphere of afflicted spirits;

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti’.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: they cannot die without having realized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ pajānāti evaṁ passati, ayaṁ vuccati: ‘sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam pajānāti evam passati ayam vuccati sotāpannaḥ a vinipāta dhammo niyataḥ sambodhi parāyanaḥ ti
translated: “Bhikkhus, those who know and see these ideas thus are called ‘stream-enterers, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, with enlightenment as their destination.’”🔽The first section for recitation on the Dhamma-follower is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Rūpa, etc.
The Eye, etc.
Rūpa
At Sāvatthī.

original: “Rūpā, bhikkhave, aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino;🔽saddā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino;
analyzed: rūpāḥ bhikkhave aniccāḥ vipariṇāminaḥ aññathābhāvinaḥ  saddāḥ aniccāḥ vipariṇāminaḥ aññathābhāvinaḥ
translated: “Bhikkhus, forms are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.🔽Sounds are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
Odours are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
Tastes are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
Tangibles are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
Mental phenomena are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṁ vuccati saddhānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṁ, sappurisabhūmiṁ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṁ;
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam saddahati adhimuccati ayam vuccati saddhā anusārī okkantaḥ sammatta niyāma sappurisa bhūmim okkantaḥ vītivattaḥ puthujjana bhūmi
translated: “One who has confidence in these teachings and resolves on them thus is called a faith-follower, one who has entered the fixed course of rightness, entered the plane of superior persons, transcended the plane of the worldlings.

original: abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: He is incapable of doing any deed by reason of which he might be reborn in hell or in an animal womb or in the realm of hungry shades.

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: He is incapable of passing away until he has realized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: Yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṁ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṁ khamanti, ayaṁ vuccati: ‘dhammānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṁ, sappurisabhūmiṁ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṁ;
analyzed: yassa kho bhikkhave ime dhammā evam paññāya mattasaḥ nijjhānam khamanti ayam vuccati dhamma anusārī okkantaḥ sammatta niyāma sappurisa bhūmim okkantaḥ vītivatto puthujjana bhūmi
translated: “One in whom these things exist and who possesses them in this way is called a Dhamma-follower, one who has entered the fixed course of rightness, entered the plane of superior persons, transcended the plane of the worldlings.

original: abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: He’s incapable of doing any action whose result is hell, animal realm, or ghost realm.

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti’.🔽Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ pajānāti evaṁ passati, ayaṁ vuccati:
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti  yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam pajānāti evam passati ayam vuccati
translated: And he’s incapable of dying without realizing the fruit of stream-entry.”

analyzed: sotāpannaḥ a vinipāta dhammaḥ niyataḥ sambodhi parāyanaḥ ti
translated: “Anyone who understands and sees these things is called a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the lower world, fixed in destiny, headed for enlightenment.”🔽The second section on the stream-enterer is finished.

headed for enlightenment.”🔽The third section on the stream-enterer is finished.

Fifth.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 35.117–126🔽The Six Sense Fields
Perception of Forms
At Sāvatthī.

analyzed: rūpa saññā bhikkhave aniccā vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī
translated: “Bhikkhus, perception of forms is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.
Perception of sounds …🔽Perception of odors …
Perception of tastes …
Perception of tactile objects …
Perception of mental phenomena is impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṁ vuccati ‘saddhānusārī …pe…
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam saddahati adhimuccati ayam vuccati saddhā anusārī pe
translated: “Whoever has confidence in these teachings and resolves upon them thus is called a noble disciple with developed confidence, one who has arrived at this true Dhamma, entered into this true Dhamma, and who has full confidence in this true Dhamma.
and is headed for complete awakening.’
Sixth.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 35.127–136
The Six Sense Fields

At Sāvatthī.

analyzed: rūpa sañcetanā bhikkhave aniccā vipariṇāmī aññathābhāvī  sat dasat cetanā
translated: “Bhikkhus, intentional activities related to forms are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.🔽Intentional activities related to sounds …
Intentional activities related to odors …🔽Intentional activities related to tastes …
Intentional activities related to tactile objects …

Intentional activities related to mental phenomena are impermanent, changing, becoming otherwise.🔽“Bhikkhus, whatever ascetics and brahmins in the future will dwell perceiving what is impermanent as permanent …

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ saddahati adhimuccati, ayaṁ vuccati ‘saddhānusārī …pe…

one heading for a happy destination.”🔽The seventh section on the one of developed faculties is finished.🔽The Connected Discourses with Rāhula, the first, is finished.

original: abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: The Linked Discourses with Māra, the first section, is completed.🔽The Linked Discourses with Māra, the first section, is completed.

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: The Linked Discourses with Māra, the first section, is completed.

original: Yassa kho, bhikkhave, ime dhammā evaṁ paññāya mattaso nijjhānaṁ khamanti, ayaṁ vuccati: ‘dhammānusārī, okkanto sammattaniyāmaṁ, sappurisabhūmiṁ okkanto, vītivatto puthujjanabhūmiṁ;
analyzed: yassa kho bhikkhave ime dhammā evam paññāya mattasaḥ nijjhānam khamanti ayam vuccati dhamma anusārī okkantaḥ sammatta niyāma sappurisa bhūmim okkantaḥ vītivatto puthujjana bhūmi
translated: “Bhikkhus, when these things are known and seen in this way, one is called a Dhamma-follower, one who has entered the fixed course of rightness, entered the plane of superior persons, transcended the plane of the worldlings.

original: abhabbo taṁ kammaṁ kātuṁ, yaṁ kammaṁ katvā nirayaṁ vā tiracchānayoniṁ vā pettivisayaṁ vā upapajjeyya;
analyzed: abhabbaḥ tam kammam kātu yam kammam katvā nirayam vā tiracchāna yonim vā pettivisayam vā upapajjeyya
translated: One is incapable of doing any deed by reason of which one might be reborn in hell, in the animal realm, or in the domain of ghosts; in an unhappy destination, in a bad destination, in the nether world.

original: abhabbo ca tāva kālaṁ kātuṁ yāva na sotāpattiphalaṁ sacchikaroti’.
analyzed: abhabbaḥ ca tāva kālam kātum yāva na sotāpatti phalam sacchikaroti
translated: One cannot possibly die without having attained the fruit of stream-entry.”

original: Yo, bhikkhave, ime dhamme evaṁ pajānāti evaṁ passati, ayaṁ vuccati:🔽‘sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyano’”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ bhikkhave ime dhamme evam pajānāti evam passati ayam vuccati  sotāpannaḥ a vinipāta dhammaḥ niyataḥ sambodhi parāyanaḥ ti
translated: “Bhikkhus, when one knows and sees these things in this way, one is called a stream-enterer, no longer bound to the nether world, fixed in destiny, with enlightenment as one’s destination.”
So it was with reference to this that it was said: “One should not neglect wisdom, should preserve truth, should cultivate relinquishment, and should train for peace.”
The first sub-chapter on the eye is finished.

original: Cakkhu rūpañca viññāṇaṁ,🔽phasso ca vedanāya ca;

translated: Eye, visible object, and consciousness,🔽Contact, and also feeling and perception;
Intention, craving, and element,
With the aggregates, these are the ten.🔽The Linked Discourses with Okkanta are complete.
The Linked Discourses with Okkanta are complete.
